column2: the more ___, the more ... / especially when ___, the more ...
the more you live, the more...
the more you go/as time goes by, you are becoming more and more ...
The more delicious it is, the better it sells.
Especially as a student, you need to read many books.
Andy keeps getting better at Korean.
I'm thinking of going home. (soliciting feedback)
I'd like to do it alone. (Nicer than 혼자 할래요.)
I don't want to go. (More persistent than 저는 안 가고 싶어요.)
Do you want to drink coffee or tea?
When do you want to meet?
Do you want to see this?
Do you want to die? (idiom for telling someone to not be so annoying)
It can't be that .../there's no reason that ... (present & future tense)
It can't be that they don't know.
There's no way tomorrow is Sunday.

column1: 앤디 씨가 안 왔을 리가 없어요.
column2: There's no way Andy didn't come (yet).
Female co-host of Korean Grammar Level 4.
Founder of TTMIK, and co-host of Korean Grammar Level 4.
There's no way it's not cold.
You can turn on the light.
Is it okay if I do it tomorrow?
It's okay if you don't work today.
I'm in the middle of a meeting.
Between this book and that book...
It is between the bank and the park.
You shouldn't eat anything at all.
Have you tried using this before?
Shall we try going in? (e.g., club, ghost house)
to look into something; to recognize (e.g., face, song)
to keep a watchful eye on someone/something
I will try it out first.
not appropriate (e.g., for the current situation)
What is something you always do?
I always wanted to ask you.
I study Korean all the time, but it's still hard.
These days, I rarely work out.

column1: 시간이 없어서 친구들을 거의 못 만나요.
column2: I don't have time, so I almost never meet my friends.
not any word; not any mention (variant 1)
not any word; not any mention (variant 2)
You didn't tell anyone, did you?
to be alright; to be okay
just in any way; however you like it
It's nothing. (deflecting when hiding something personal)
Why did you not come yesterday? (yesterday contraction)
What is your favorite color? (lit. Which color is the best?)
Who is the person that came here first?

column1: 요즘 가장 인기 있는 가수는 누구예요?
column2: These days, who is the most popular singer?
